description.narrative: BioCarbon Group Pte. Limited (BioCarbon, the Company), registered in Singapore, has been established to invest in Avoided Deforestation (AD) projects in emerging markets. These projects will conserve forests from being converted into other forms of land-use and generate carbon credits the sale of which will be the main source of income for the Project. BioCarbon is in the process of raising circa US$25 million of new capital. The proceeds will be used for (i) pre-development work in the identified sites for AD work; (ii) investment in concessions in Indonesia to be undertaken over the course of next 12-18 months, (iii) next two year development costs for projects in Indonesia and (iv) development of a pipeline of AD projects outside Indonesia.

Climate change mitigation and adaptation is one of the World Bank Groups strategic priorities. IFC has identified the forest sector as one of the key pillars of its climate change mitigation strategy. The following outlines the key development impacts of the proposed transaction.
The Project will directly help in climate change mitigation through avoided deforestation of mainly tropical rainforests in several countries where these forests are seriously threatened. The Project will result in intervention in sites where there is a significant threat of biodiversity loss. The Project will provide for direct benefit sharing with local communities and local governments as well as development of alternative livelihood strategies for the local communities. The Project would support one of the early private sector initiatives for conservation of forests and is likely to have a demonstration impact that could catalyze large amounts of private capital in this sector. Finally, the Project is expected to demonstrate the viability of AD projects and serve as a test case for advancing the discussions on the adoption of an international Reduced Emissions from Deforestation and Degradation (REDD) framework.
